message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.AI, cs.SE, cs.SI 

This paper is primarily focused on intrusion detection in industrial networks, which falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The paper also discusses the unique requirements and challenges of intrusion detection in industrial networks, which involves high volumes of data and the need for real-time detection to prevent revenue loss. This suggests that the paper could also be classified under the sub-category of networking and internet architecture (cs.NI). The paper also discusses the use of contextual information to enhance intrusion detection, which could fall under the sub-categories of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and software engineering (cs.SE). Finally, the paper discusses the use of manufacturing execution systems and enterprise resource planning to provide contextual information, which could fall under the sub-category of social and information networks (cs.SI).
